data.name: Name of the light.
data.module: The module number, one indexed, normally starts at unit where buttons are plugged in and increments along the CAN cable.

light.description: Add a light, uncheck the box to stop adding.
light.title: Add a light

import_method.description: Choose how you want to configure your Dobiss lights. Importing from config.dobiss is much faster and ensures all names and settings match your Dobiss configuration.
import_method.title: Configuration Method

upload_config.description: Upload your config.dobiss file from the Dobiss Ambiance software. On Windows, it's typically located at: {location}
upload_config.title: Upload config.dobiss

select_outputs.description: Found {count} outputs. Select which ones you want to add to Home Assistant. All are selected by default.
select_outputs.title: Select Outputs

init.description: Manage your Dobiss lights. Current lights: {count}.
init.title: Manage Lights

error.no_outputs: No outputs found in config file
error.parse_error: Failed to parse config.dobiss file. Make sure it's a valid Dobiss configuration file.
